instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A suddenly shutdown
threads.message:
this board suddenly shut down when it is on battery, but on the charger, it works fine. I think it is a battery problem...
does anyone have a similar case?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A suddenly shutdown
threads.message:
You should test known good battery, to discard battery issue.

Can still be a problem with FDMF6808 chips.
Some software mods can disable CPU sleep states (Cx); you can then see if still turns off with battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A suddenly shutdown
threads.message:
Sorry, it is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A there is no FDMF6808 chips.
I changed the battery but it still shut down suddenly. 
what I have to try next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A suddenly shutdown
threads.message:
"there is no FDMF6808 chips "
Really???
Check page 59...

You should try a software mod first, if no real new FDMF6708 chips available.
Do NOT use (refurbished) "new" FDMF6806 chips from China!
